intro: Sphaeralcea tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Sphaeralcea tehuelches is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
